content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

The function should return the cleaned string.

You will have to write the following:
- A conditional expression that determines if `col` has a value
- If so, lowercase it (with `str.lower()`)
- Strip any leading and trailing whitespaces (using `str.strip()`)
- Replace spaces with underscores using `str.replace(" ", "_")`
- Replace hyphens with underscores using `str.replace("-", "_")`
- Return the cleaned value, or raise an error if it doesn't have a value (the conditional expression should be able to tell you that)
